Citation.sTitle: Measurement of Mineral Solubilities in the Quaternary Systems KCl MgCl2 ZnCl2 H2O and KCl MgCl2 PbCl2 H2O at 373 K
Citation.sAbstract: In this work, the solubilities of the salt minerals in quaternary systems potassium chloride magnesium chloride zinc chloride water and potassium chloride magnesium chloride lead chloride water were measured at 373 K using an isothermal dissolution equilibrium method. Phase diagrams were constructed based on compositions of saturated liquid phase and existing equilibrium solid phase. By X-ray powder diffraction identification, a variety of solid forms were determined for the quaternary system KCl MgCl2 ZnCl2 H2O at 373 K. Not only were three single salts KCl, ZnCl2, and MgCl2*6H2O determined but also three double salts KCl*MgCl2*6H2O(Car), 2KCl*ZnCl2, and MgCl2*ZnCl2*5H2O were detected. It also demonstrated that five precipitates KCl, MgCl2*6H2O, KCl*MgCl2*6H2O(Car), KCl*2PbCl2, and PbCl2 were formed in the quaternary system KCl MgCl2 PbCl2 H2O at 373 K.
